title: City Council To Consider Ban On Handheld Electronics While Driving
text:
City Council To Consider Ban On Handheld Electronics While Driving October 13, 2015, 5:54 PM by Leland Steva SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
A ban on using handheld electronics while driving is moving forward in Sioux Falls. 
City Council member Michelle Erpenbach brought the idea to the Public Services Committee on Tuesday. That group has now decided to bring the first reading of the electronic ban for drivers to the full city council. 
A second reading is tentatively scheduled for November 10. That would be the date where the council could hear public input. 
This ban does have a few expectations including for people in emergency vehicles; they could still use phones while performing official duties. The ban also allows all drivers to use hands-free modes of operation. 
14 states in the U.S. ban talking while on a handheld cell phone when driving. 36 states do not have any sort of bans against talking and driving. Four states have partial bans; many of those are tied to young drivers. Several cities across the country have their own bans on the books.
